seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Don't be fooled this weekend, there is a lot happening in NWA despite what others may try to make you believe.

  • Fun-damental Skills: The Women of OZ Flagship Ride is happening Saturday. Its a monthly clinic where women who MTB - or would like to learn how to MTB can learn together.
  • Printed: Create your own town tour this weekend by finding each public art piece or mural in your town.
  • Egg-celent: An egg drop, easter bunny photos, and egg hunt is all happening this weekend at Rivercrest Orchard Farms in Fayetteville.
  • Refurbished: Starting today and running through Sunday is Vintage Market Days behind held in Bentonville.
  • On the run: Also happening this weekend in Bentonville is the Bentonville Half Marathon which starts 7a early Saturday morning.
  • Farm to table: Down south in Fayetteville, the Farmers Market officially kicks off on Saturday marking its 50th anniversary season.
  • Going live: And finally, you have plenty of options of live music this weekend as always with the Talking Tunes rundown of shows and concerts.

Have a fantastic weekend and make sure to fool someone on Saturday - its April 1!

posts.title: Start-up Junkie Launches Fuel For Your Health Accelerator Program
posts.content:
The Startup Junkie Foundation's Fuel Accelerator is expanding its scope to focus on health-related innovations and technologies with its new cohort, Fuel For Your Health.

  • Accelerated success: The program provides startups access to founders, mentorship, and education, and has received support from the Arkansas Economic Development Commission, as well as the Walton Family Foundation.
  • International innovation: This cohort brings together a diverse range of solutions from seven countries around the world to Northwest Arkansas, from AI platforms detecting diabetes to improving the quality of life for elders.

To learn more about Fuel For Your Health, go here.

posts.title: Groundbreaking for Alice L. Walton School of Medicine in Bentonville
posts.content:
Walmart heir and philanthropist Alice Walton celebrated with local providers, construction crews, and stakeholders at the groundbreaking for the Alice L. Walton School of Medicine (AWSOM) in Bentonville.

  • Mission-driven: AWSOM will offer a 4-year medical degree focusing on the humanities, arts and health and wellness, in order to provide better health outcomes and quality care.
  • What's in a name?: Walton may not have been a fan of the name for the school, but she does love the acronym "AWSOM".

Learn more about the Alice L. Walton School of Medicine here.

posts.title: Climbing Access Coming to Fitzgerald Mountain with ARCC, NWA Trailblazers and the Access Fund
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas is getting a new rock climbing area this Spring, opened in partnership by the Arkansas Climbers Coalition, Northwest Arkansas Trailblazers, and the Access Fund.

  • Enter Fitzgerald Mountain: The area will be on property owned by the NWA Trailblazers near Fitzgerald Mountain in Springdale and includes bouldering and climbing access.
  • Smart infrastructure: This work is designed to set climbing areas up for long-term sustainable access that protects the environment and includes stone staircases, retaining walls, durable trails, and appropriate drainage.

To learn more, read the article here.

posts.title: Women Leading The Way In NWA Nonprofit Work
posts.content:
Women like Carol Silva Moralez, President & CEO of Upskill NWA, which helps students facing barriers to quality jobs earn degrees and professional credentials to land high-earning careers in the healthcare sector, are leading our community toward a brighter, more equitable future. Here are a few other women doing fantastic work in Northwest Arkansas's nonprofit space: 

  • Community builders: Yolanda Fields ensures the community can access essential resources as Community Resource Director/Equity Officer for the City of Fayetteville. Teresa Mills, CEO of Peace at Home Family Shelter, empowers domestic violence victims through education, outreach, and advocacy. 
  • Forming connections: Christina Williams, Founder & Executive Director of Circles NWA, helps low-income individuals and families pursue upward mobility by developing cohorts to walk the journey to economic stability together.

Click any of the above links to learn ways to get involved or explore initiatives by the Excellerate Foundation HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by Hark at Excellerate Foundation

posts.title: New Outdoor Restaurant and Beer Garden Coming Soon to Fayetteville
posts.content:
Local foodies, you've got a new outdoor restaurant coming your way from the folks behind Feed & Folly. The new restaurant will be in Fayetteville and will be called City Park.

  • Trailside: Located in the former AT&T truck station, City Park will serve up Texas-style barbecue, smashburgers, street tacos, and trailside snacks, all with easy access to the trail system.
  • Flood of Fun: The project may come together in two phases and plans include landscaping, shaded seating, fans, and outdoor games like a bocce ball court. Construction could be completed by the end of the year.

Keep up with the developments HERE.

posts.title: Heartland Forward Analyzes Economic Performance of America's Metros
posts.content:
Heartland Forward released its 2022 report analyzing the economic performance of America’s metropolitan areas.

  • Innovation powerhouse: Silicon Valley's San Jose-Sunnyvale-Santa Clara topped the list for its No. 1 rating for young firm knowledge intensity and bold environment.
  • Heartland resurgence: 367 metros showed gains since 2020, and long-stagnant heartland metros are on the rebound with a focus on innovative capacity and lifestyle.

Read the full report HERE.

posts.title: Don't Miss NWA Book Fest This April
posts.content:
Underbrush Books and Ozark Beer Co. are joining forces for the first-ever NWA Book Fest, taking place Apr 1!

  • A celebration of books: This free event will feature over 2 dozen local authors and publishers, 12 makers and small business pop-ups, and 8 local independent bookstores.
  • Support the community: The festival will provide support for authors and businesses on both ends of the spectrum, from established to not-yet-published. Join in to get your hands on a book, hear some live readings, and spend some time in the local literary community.

Get more info about the event HERE.

posts.title: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill and Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen & Bar Set To Debut in Rogers in  2024
posts.content:
ICYMI Rogers will soon be home to two new restaurants: Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen and Bar and Firebirds Wood Fired Grill, both arriving in late 2024!

  • Soulful dishes: Tupelo Honey offers Southern favorites like honey-dusted fried chicken, shrimp and grits, and chicken and waffles.
  • American favorites: Firebirds serves up steak, seafood, and other signature dishes, perfect for an evening out.

For information on the Pinnacle Spring's development, check it out HERE.

posts.title: A Guide to Some of Our Favorite Murals in NWA
posts.content:
Unlock the vibrant colors of Northwest Arkansas with our crew's favorite murals in the big four cities!

  • Springdale: Be sure to check out The Peddler by Mike Abb, Kenneth Siemens, and Corey Milford.
  • Rogers: Visit picturesque WaterStop by Ocatavio Logo, Jason Jones, Mantra, and Lakwena with Graham Edwards.

See all the murals on our list HERE.

posts.title: U of A Receives International Acclaim for Anthony Timberlands Center for Design and Materials Innovation
posts.content:
The University of Arkansas' Anthony Timberlands Center for Design and Materials Innovation has been recognized as the Future Project of the Year 2023 by The Architectural Review, making it the sole North American project to earn an award from the esteemed panel of judges.

  • International spotlight: The project was chosen among sixteen projects from around the world, and is set to be presented June 8 at FOOTPRINT+, a zero-carbon property event in Brighton, England.
  • Model of sustainability: The Anthony Timberlands Center will be the first of its kind, a research center focused on the research and development of new wood products and new approaches in sustainable construction materials.

Read more on the project HERE.

posts.title: Heartland Challenge Startup Expo to Showcase Innovative Student Ventures
posts.content:
The 2023 Heartland Challenge Startup Competition presents the Startup Expo taking place on Apr 15, where 12 semi-finalist teams will be on display for the public to explore and engage with.

  • With a side of learning: Attendees can enjoy free food and drinks while learning about the participating startups and casting their vote for a $5,000 audience favorite prize.
  • Venture Journey: The Heartland Challenge simulates the process of raising venture capital for high-growth enterprises and is Arkansas's first global student startup competition. Since its virtual debut in Spring 2020, the competition has awarded over $350,000 to deserving startups.

Mark your calendars and register for the Startup Expo HERE.

posts.title: Network Mapping Study Identifies Strategies for Supporting Entrepreneurship in NWA
posts.content:
A new network mapping study from Endeavor Insight and the Walton Family Foundation sheds light on the strategies needed to continue the growth of Northwest Arkansas's entrepreneurial ecosystem.

  • Drivers: Entrepreneurial support organizations and institutional investors are providing more than two-thirds of all network connections, making them essential drivers of connectivity.
  • Connectivity: While founder-to-founder connectivity exists in NWA, support organizations can help build more of this infrastructure and create more formal and informal mentorship opportunities.

Find out more in the full report HERE.

posts.title: Grand Opening of Rogers Clinic Offers Subscription Based Healthcare Option
posts.content:
An innovative new clinic is shaking up the healthcare industry in Rogers by cutting out the insurance companies.

  • Subscription-based: Simplified Health runs on a subscription model of $59/month for adults, $29/month for kids, and allows for unlimited doctor visits without the copays and insurance bills associated with traditional medical systems.
  • Price transparency: Dr. Blake Hansen said through cutting out the insurance companies, he can be more transparent about what care will cost, likely saving patients money and giving them the opportunity to take back control of their healthcare and finances.

Check out Simplified Health HERE.

posts.title: Easter Fun at Rivercrest Orchard
posts.content:
Head over to Rivercrest Orchard this April for an Easter celebration!

  • Egg Hunt: The Egg Drop takes place at 12p and 2p on Apr 1 - 2, 6p on Apr 7, and 4p on Apr 9.
  • Activities: Purchase tickets and enjoy Rivercrest Orchard bags for hunting eggs, Easter Bunny photo opportunities, unlimited bounce pillows, bumper, cars, bubble barn, barn chute slide, train ride, and hog train, barnyard playground, candy, and prizes.

Find out more HERE.

posts.title: Get Ready For The Amazeum's UnGala FUNdraiser, presented by Nabholz Construction
posts.content:
Play like a kid, eat, drink, and raise money for a great cause at the Scott Family Amazeum’s UnGala, an annual FUNdraiser for ages 21+ where you can experience one-of-a-kind activities that spark creativity and curiosity, on Apr 21, from 6-10p.

  • Kidding around: Race others in a souped-up, 24-volt racer, and try pewter casting, screen printing, and other cool hands-on activities. There will be an all-you-can-eat food truck buffet and mad-scientist cocktails!
  • Play with purpose: Thanks to the UnGala, the Amazeum can continue its nonprofit mission by hosting Priceless Nights, keeping the cost of general admission low, and providing professional development opportunities for local educators.

Prepare to unleash your creativity and get your tickets HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by the Scott Family Amazeum

posts.title: Exploring the Best Parks in Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
If you’re like us, this stint of the warmth has you itching to be outside as much as you can. And what better place to do that than a local park? 

  • Play: Our park guide is by no means a comprehensive list of parks in Northwest Arkansas, but it has some of our favorites. We’re sure you’ll find the perfect spot, whether you’re looking to host a party, go on a solitary walk, or take your kids to play. 
  • Types: In the guide, you’ll find bike parks with pump tracks, parks with vast acreage, ponds, lakes, playgrounds, trails, sports courts, and so much more. 

Check out our NWA Daily Park Guide HERE.

posts.title: Walton Family Foundation Launches Pilot Program Connecting Nonprofits to Federal Grants
posts.content:
The Walton Family Foundation has launched its Connection Hub; a two-year pilot program designed to help Arkansas nonprofits access federal grant funding.

  • One-stop shop: With access to education, technical assistance, grant-writing and assessment tools, the Hub will support nonprofits in areas such as early childhood health and education, food insecurity, and individual and family economic stability.
  • Capacity building: The Hub will provide capacity and resources to help nonprofits recover from the pandemic and better position themselves to secure federal funding.

Read more of the story HERE.

posts.title: Celebrate Turpentine Creek's 31st Anniversary with Carole Baskin
posts.content:
The Turpentine Creek Wildlife Refuge is celebrating their 31st anniversary with a "Feast with the Beasts" event, and they've invited Carole Baskin of “Tiger King” fame to join them as the keynote speaker!

  • Celebrate: Taking place Apr 29 from 3:30-8p, the event will feature happy hour in the Discovery Area, a special tram tour, dinner and live music.
  • Support: Tickets are limited, so grab yours soon. Proceeds go toward the animals of the refuge, and never-before-seen footage of their rescues will be shared.

Find out more from the Turpentine Creek Wildlife Refuge event HERE.

posts.title: Growing Cycling Economy is Benefiting NWA
posts.content:
Cycling is a billion-dollar industry in Northwest Arkansas, with hundreds of locals and outsiders alike taking advantage of the Razorback Regional Greenway, local trails and destinations.

  • Historic: The sport has been popular in the region since the Highroller Cyclery opened in Fayetteville in 1972, and the Joe Martin Stage Race began in 1978.
  • A big wheel: Cycling's growth as an activity, sport, and mode of transportation is having a major economic impact, from tourism and retail to manufacturing, wholesale and infrastructure.

Learn more about the booming industry HERE.

posts.title: Squeaky Wheel Casting Seeks Bentonville Homeowners for Home Renovation Show
posts.content:
Squeaky Wheel Casting is searching for homeowners in Bentonville and the surrounding area interested in being on a home renovation show! To qualify, applicants must:

  • Live near Bentonville: Be within 30 minutes of Bentonville, but they cannot be in Fayetteville (due to potential zoning and permitting issues).
  • Renovation budget: To qualify, homeowners must have a reno budget of $120,000 or more.

To have a chance to make your home the one you've always dreamed of, learn more and apply HERE.

posts.title: Get Ready for Vintage Market Days 2023 in Bentonville
posts.content:
Vintage Market Days is coming to Bentonville from Mar 31 to Apr 2. Enjoy perusing original art, antiques, clothing, jewelry, and more at this three-day event.

  • What to expect: Three days of shopping along with food trucks and fun with friends! There will be over 150 vendors from 15 states with a variety of handmade goods to pick from.
  • Kid-friendly: Admission for children under 12 is free, and tickets are good for weekend-long re-entry.

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Exploring the Charming Bentonville
posts.content:
Timeout featured Bentonville as one of the top 16 "Unexpected US Weekend Getaways". Nestled in the Ozark Mountains, Bentonville left an impression on the authors as a charming alternative to nearby Southern cities.

  • Cultural Immersion: From the Walmart Museum to the stunning Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art, Bentonville is ripe for exploring for the weekend traveler.
  • Get outside: There's a seemingly endless amount of trails to bike, hike, or explore the natural landscape before deciding which of the many great restaurants downtown to eat at.

This article is a good reminder for us locals to do a staycation every now and then to really appreciate all the fun things we have here. See what other towns made the list alongside Bentonville HERE.
